< Review>
I locked my keys in my car. I contacted my insurance company. They assigned a towing company, Magic Towing. Their estimated arrival time was going to be over an hour. The weather is about 40 degrees F. I was expecting to be locked out of my car so I was underdressed. When I called Magic Company and asked if they can come sooner, they declined, indicating it will take them another 40 mins.  I finally called Randy's Towing. Randy showed up promptly!! He was fast and professional. He also accepted my insurance car. If I get into this sitaution again or if one needs a referral, I HIGHLY recommend Randy's Towing. Do not use Magic Towing, unless you want to wait around for over an hour! Thank you Randy. I was able to get home,  finish my errand  and now I can enjoy the rest of my day and weekend! You were a blessing!</Review>

<rate>5<//rate>< text>
I found Old Harbor Insurance on a fluke...I was in a last minute pinch to find new short term rental insurance for our vineyard estate in Temecula when Carlo & Crystal came to my rescue.  They quickly went to work to find me a new company.  Carlo created this very cool and informative video explaining to me my options and after the video spent even more time on the phone with me answering my many questions and helping me to pick the best coverage option for our property and at a substantial savings over my previous policy. Crystal took care of tying up the loose ends and made sure I had my new policy in place right on time with no lapse in coverage.  They made my last minute stressful situation actually pleasant and enjoyable.

I loved working with Old Harbor so much that I just finished switching over all of our personal insurance accounts as well.  Two cars, homeowners, earthquake and an umbrella policy to boot. When all was said and done,  Crystal was able to save me about $1300 from our previous insurance carrier!  She was amazing, making the switch once again seamless and easy.  I am so happy to of found Old Harbor.  They have taken such good care of all our insurance needs, saved me money and made it so I will never look any farther.  Thanks Carlo & Crystal!!</text>

<Name>DR ROBERT Hasty< /Name>< text>
Dr. Mosier is a life-savor as far as I am concerned.  The ophthalmologist my physician had called to help with my iritis was not available.  So he called his on-call ophthalmologist--Dr. Mosier.  Since my condition needed daily attention and it was Memorial Day weekend, Dr. Mosier met with me each weekend day.  In the process, he was able to diagnose the cause of the iritis as a disease which had been misdiagnosed my entire adult life [I was nearing my 50th birthday].  Since then, I have seen Dr. Mosier for all of my eye needs, including removable of cataracts in both eyes.  His greatest skill is his ability to remain calm and reassuring, regardless of what my fears were.  His demeanor is so calming and reassuring.  He is also my wife's doctor.  Her eye pressure, in both eyes, is always a concern.  Still, Dr. Mosier's skill and know;ledge has been most reassuring.  My Rheumatologist is retiring in December.  I hope Dr. Mosier goes on forever!  He is the best!!</text>

<review>Great layout for drinks/and shows. General admission you have to stand. If it's a show you're not all that into it's a good situation for going back and forth from show area and bar. I can't stand that long so I thought seated tickets were worth it. If you're a smoker, they have a smoker's area so you don't have to leave the venue, and you can bring your drink! Parking is limited and expensive. I'd definitely go again and would recommend it.<//review></record>

My old band, Lipstick Conspiracy played there years ago!

I've been a patient off Dr. Pam's for over 30 years. Since then and 2 additional dentists and larger staff later, I still enjoy outstanding customer service and excellent care. Everyone on the staff is professional and friendly and they are always on time; but they also are very technical and stay abreast of advancements in their field. This office makes time for continuous training and it shows.  I'll never go anywhere else - I started here solo and then brought my husband, then my son and have referred countless numbers of people and they are all still patients. <userid>116301862913174858788<//userid><username>M J<//username><date>1555437495155< /date>< rate>
5< /rate>
<Review>Apologies for typos, spelling and grammar. ESL
Hello, I'll share with you all how my first experience went with this dental office.

First thing first, I had to book far out since they are busy as they are quite popular. I now understand why that is--they're great.

Easily accessible since they had their own parking space in the back.

I was a new client, so these were the following services that I received in order (different work stations). YMMV, your experience may differ depending on what needs to be done.

1) x-rays / screening off my teeth. This is where the lady also asked me general questions, made sure I filled out all the necessary paperwork. Then, asked me more specific questions regarding my health questionnaire that I filled out. She then proceeded to take x-rays of my teeth.

2) dental hygienist: performed gum assessment, general cleaning and finished it with some flossing. Pretty spot on about my mouth and the assessments that she made. I visited another dental office not too long ago prior to this visit.

3) Impression (they take pictures and create a 3-d model of it) - They provided some service that basically stimulated if I had braces / Invisalign and took thorough pictures of my teeth during this station

4) The dentist - Dr. Pam (?) did some explanations of my teeth and why they are the way they are today. She was insightful. Dr. Pam checked up on my teeth thoroughly and made sure I understand the anatomy of it at a high level.

5) Consultation / booking next appointment ‚Äì Amy was breaking down the payment plan and set up a future appointment.

During each service/work station, the staff made sure that I was always comfortable. They took the time to explain to me, so I understood what they were doing in my mouth. They were also honest and upfront with me about the costs. They also had a screen in each work station that showed the work that was being performed (via a camera attached to the dental tool).

Overall, professional. The technology they have there also drew me in. This dental office has set the bar for all the other dentists that I visited.

This was definitely a big shift from my previous dentist office who seemed lacking in technology. The cool thing too is that they also send out reminders and calender invites.  So, I definitely appreciate all the tech this office is using!</Review>< Pics>
None< /Pics>

<Date>1399580115538<//Date>< rating>

< Review>
The very first dentist experience I can remember was jumping out of the dentist chair and running straight into my mom's arms because I was so scared. They had to hold me down the rest of the appointment. I would have never thought after that first traumatizing experience that I would be such a fan of a DENTIST! But here, from the moment you walk in and are greeted by Tanya or Mariann with a warm smile, the experience is always a pleasant one. They are a step above the rest because unlike so many other businesses the great hospitality does not just stop there. My hygienist, Jonae always gets me promptly for my appointment and greets me by name which makes me feel valued and welcomed. She is always so concerned if I am comfortable and always takes the time to explain what she is doing to keep me in the loop. When Dr. Pam comes in to check-in she always gives me great innovative, and cost effective tips on how to keep my gums in great condition and my teeth healthy and sparkling white. It is clear that the employees here all care about the general well-being of the patients and are passionate about what they do. I highly recommend this Dental Office.</Review>

<Date>1464842264114<//Date><rating>4< /rating>< Text>
This place has been opened for a few months, but it doesn't look they get enough traffic. I've tried their gyros a few times, and they're decent. Not the best I've had, but definitely not the worst. I'd go there from time to time again if I'm craving for some gyros.

The thing is, there's nothing special about the shop itself. Decoration is pretty bland and nothing going on I usually just get my food to go. They probably should try a bit harder making customers comfortable.< /Text>

< Review>
After shopping a few different online stores looking for furniture we found what we were looking for at Mathis Brothers. We wanted full delivery in-room delivery but couldn't find that option on the website. I called the toll free# and Ms. Lacie Dunbar answered. My experience wth her was one of the best retail experiences I've ever had. She was equally professional and cheerful. She was able to answer all my questions quickly and thoroughly. The whole process of placing my order, setting up the proper delivery, payment, and confirmation was less than 10 minutes and it was a joy. When I asked if there was a survey link or supervisor contact so I could share my experience she wasn't sure because no one had ever asked to leave a comment. That's a tragedy because people need to be recognized for superior performance not just for mistakes and failures. I hope her supervisor sees this and she gets the acknowledgement she deserves.  I will continue to shop with Mathis Brothers for the foreseeable future because of LACIE DUNBAR. Excellent employee with a real attitude for customer service. Thank you.< /Review>

< name>
SANDRA FONSECA< /name>
<time>1623641348202</time>< rating>
1< /rating>
< Review>
My choice to leave 1 star was for the respectful and helpful service we received from Carolyn at the Ontario Matthis Brother's  showroom today, June 13th at 5:20pm.  Less than a year ago, my son Nicholas and I decided to purchase our very 1st sofa at Matthis Brothers after visiting many other furniture stores.  As a single parent, we've  been fortunate family and friends have given us their used furniture.  This purchase was meaningful because it was our first and also because we fell in love with the color, material,, feel, and and comfort of the sectional.  The price was beyond our means, so we thought about the purchase well. Eric helped us and was good at selling us the sofa, cleaning warranty, arranging shipping, telling us we would get money back with rewards.
2 months after delivery, the sofa began to dropped , and we noticed 2 of the backs were missing filling because they were not at shapely or firm as the other.  I called Eric right away, and he told me to take them to service area because they would not be picked up.  Today, we finally made the trip and took 2 seat cushions and 2 backs.  The manager, Maria was not helpful and told me that without my receipt, she couldn't help me.  I insisted of a different way to find my info beside my name and phone number.  I mentioned I have the reward program and receive emails.  Her approach was like pulling teeth.  Instead of finding solutions for me, she immediately dismissed my frustration of having to return from L.A. to find a receipt that I might no longer have.  I called Eric and placed him on speaker. He couldn't help.  Finally we went onto the store, and two young ladies at the front counter couldn't help me either.  Instead of directing me to a manager, I had to ask for one.
I'm grateful, Carolyn knew what to do.  She graciously helped us...with a smile.   I didn't have to buy a 4K  sectional from her to be treated with respect. Before Carolyn helped us, I did ask to have Eric meet us.  By the time Carolyn was helping us, Eric arrived.  I shared with him that he did not enter my first name or my phone number on my account, and because of this, Maria could not help me.   His reply was defensive as he shared that has never happened to him before.
I want to be respected as a customer whether I purchase a 4K sofa or not.   The 1 star is therefore given for Carolyn's support.<//Review>

<Review>We are shopping for new furniture and reviewing options.  An extremely helpful agent Lori met with us while we found an option to purchase.  It was late and Sunday.  The rep stated she would follow up - and we selected other items before heading home.  She followed up appropriately, and we were happy to find our "options" were available to order.  Since we live an over an hour away, we received email correspondence that we needed to sign and send back.  Good luck with emailing to a "ghost" account, and of course it bounced back.  We contacted the rep and informed her.  Yesterday, I had to be in Riverside and decided best course was to bring signed agreements for the special order and pay the required 40% deposit.  I wanted to reaffirm the other selections that were not special order before proceeding to the cashier line to WAIT.  It's enlightening to listen to other sales reps talking about discounts due to Presidents Day sales.  Finally, a clerk, lacking enthusiasm  waves me forward.  I attempt to provide the signed special order agreements, and my desire to provide the required deposit.  He listens but does not hear?  Instead he directs me to call the phone number on the sales sheet.  Doesn't care to understand that only 3 items were special order and not the entire order.  Again doesn't care and tells me I have attitude.  He had zero interest in the signed special order paperwork.  I chose to leave and pass the front counter asking to speak with a manager to explain.  Sam F is on the phone and when he is done I attempted to enter a dialogue explaining my perception of the clerk and what I wanted to do.  Instead he doesn't listen, and again refers to a total 40% deposit for furniture.    Really?  Is it that difficult to pull apart the pieces and meet your needs wanting 40% down on the total purchases. (the sales rep was off)  Gee an engaged client that is willing to come by the store to ensure the special order items are correct; and cashier staff and manager won't listen to understand.  I was perplexed.

<rate>5<//rate>< review>
Customer service I feel is a lost art now a days. Yesterday my hope in customer service was renewed. I was quickly greeted by an associate as opposed to walking around what was/is the biggest furniture stores I have ever been inside of. The young woman lead us right to the mattresses that would best suit our sons needs based on his sleeping habits as well as comfort levels. Carolyn was patient and answered all of the questions we had and believe me we had a lot! I think one of the most important aspects of our experience was that she did everything to keep us safe like laying down temporary bedding so that my son could lay down and try different beds out without the fear of transferring pathogens. Lastly, her suggestion on the pillows and sheets was such a great decision my son loves both and just had the best sleep of his life!

For reference my son is a pitcher in college is 19 and a side sleeper but suffers from shoulder stiffness and his old mattress was making it worse</review>

We had a really great experience with Curtis. He was extremely outgoing, helpful, and had great product knowledge which we really appreciated. Even though he was helping others as well, he consistently got back around to us in a timely fashion to answer all of our questions and find the right products for us.
The lack of inventory and time turn around was a little frustrating. It would have been helpful to have that information at the products instead of so much back and forth.</text>

< Date>
1598388594855< /Date>
< Rating>
1< /Rating>
< Review>
Mathis has a very large store with a good selection. Late last summer, I purchased just under $19,000 worth of matching patio furniture. First off, they gave me a hard time, because the mailing address of my credit card was my office address, the shipping address of the furniture was my home. This never bothered every company from Costco to Amazon to Apple to (you name it) and various other furniture retailers (I bought a new home last year and need a lot of furniture). Among the items bought at Mathis were four chaise lounges that had a slight design flaw that caused bolts to strip from the frames. Rather than getting a guy out to my house to fix them, I they just wanted to refund the money on the lounges. I didn't want that since the chaises matched everything else, and now they were discontinued items. Even IF they took everything back (they didn't offer), I didn't want that, it was difficult enough to agree with my wife on stuff to begin with.

I went back-and-forth with them for months, including contacting their main office. All I got was either robotic-like answers that they were emailing the manufacturer and even a smarmy Customer Service rep who was not pleasant at all. Their Sales Dept was not helpful, nor their home office.

I just wanted them repaired before summer was over. Ultimately I contacted A.R.T. Furniture (the manufacturer) who not only found a company to repair them, but deposited the cash in my checking account for the repair before the work was even started. A.R.T. was very sympathetic and very professional. Mathis Brothers, not so much.< /Review>
<Pics>None</Pics>< Response>
{'time': 1598391706597, 'text': "Bob, We apologize for the issues you went through with your furniture. We're sorry to hear that you did not feel you received great service, but we are pleased to hear that this issue has been resolved through our working directly with the manufacturer when we were unable to repair the pieces in-house. We hope you'll give us another chance in the future to show you the level of customer service we strive to provide and that has kept us in business for 60 years."}</Response>

< review>
Ordered a very expensive custom kitchen table. Table base had a scratch at the bottom. Okay...not the worst thing in the world. Table gets put together (connecting table top to base) and it looks good otherwise. Then I put my hand on the table top and it was super wobbly. We paid an extra 149$ for ‚Äú White Glove‚Äù service but it was far from - the workers don‚Äùt work for Mathis directly; they are subcontracted, and aren‚Äôt very versed on their furniture. After trying to tighten the screws repeatedly the table still wobbled notably. Then the workers showed me the several gaps between the base and table top preventing the screw from tightening securely and said I‚Äôd need to call a specialist from Mathis to fix it - takes a week to get one to your home. Overall, I give Mathis 1 star. The table we purchased was poorly crafted I was very disappointed given Mathis is a ‚Äúhigher end‚Äù furniture store. I Bought a adjustable bed base several months ago that broke within 3 months of use - so far Mathis is consistently missing the mark. If you are looking for high end, quality furniture, and willing to pay a little more - THIS IS NOT THE PLACE.< /review>

< Text>
I have a fantastic experience with Mathis Brothers.  As a gift may parents are buying my daughter a new bed for Christmas.  We decided a full extra long would be best for her size and the size of her room.  She's 12 and 5'6 1/2.  Unfortunately, this is not a very common size and we've had serious trouble finding any bed frames for a pre-teen a true full extra long.  We called down to Mathis Brothers to see if they offer anything of the sorts and Val Serrano was the lovely saleswoman would took our call.  Val was able to give us some ideas and a direction to start.  My daughter was interested in one of the options so we made an appointment to check it out in person.  Having never been to Mathis Brothers, I was shocked how big it was. It was like Disneyland for adults.  Temperature checks were taken at the door as well as a sanitation station to use before entering and we were given wristbands to verify we were checked.  Val met us and showed us our options.  Val was so patient, my daughter wasn't in love with what we chose over text so she showed us other options for several hours.  Once we found the perfect bed, Val explained which pieces we could used to create what we needed.  We bought the full size head and foot board and queen rails for the sides. After months of trying to figure this out with endless frustration, Val made it look effortless.  We ended up buying the whole bedroom set and she gave us ideas on finding a full extra long mattress.  Unfortunately due to covid my daughters furniture won't be available for pick up until end of December but I'm still in contact with Val as she continues to update us about our furniture status.  I was so impressed with both the amount of furniture options we had to choose from and Val's knowledge and experience in the furniture world.  I highly recommend Mathis brothers and Val to all our family and friends!<//Text>

<rating>1< /rating>< text>
You wrote a review for Mathis Brothers Furniture	12 minutes ago
1.0 star rating12/18/2020
Covid has really shown Mathis Brothers true colors. My husband and I had a the Furniture Protection plan on a couch, which we used because our dog had an accident. They were unable to repair it and issued us a store credit. We accepted this and went to the store within in the next couple of weeks to pick out a new couch. Our couch was a custom Benjamin couch and we loved it. When we went to pick out a new couch, they no longer had that maker of the couch anymore. They have these much cheaper looking couches, and we tried on two different visits, for almost 5 hours to find a replacement couch. Which we could not. We at one point ran into a Sale rep, named Lori Villas, who said we didn't need to use the store credit for the same item. We could use it on ANY thing. We asked multiple times if we needed to return the couch, since we were NOT getting a replacement for the couch. She answered each time. NO, you do not need to return the couch, the store credit is like cash, you can apply it to your purchase. Which we did. We ordered another bedroom set to replace the current one we have, and we were going to move the other one downstairs. We waited about 16 weeks for our items, and were setting up a delivery date and finalizing payment. The cashier told me they couldn't do store credit, that it would have to be a refund onto my credit card. My balance was at $0, so they said MYSynchrony would issue a check due to the negative balance. They had also asked if I would be returning anything and I told them no, because we were not exchanging a couch for a couch.

Long story short. Mathis brothers REFUSED to give us our store credit unless we returned the couch (that my husband and I had ended up having repaired because their Furniture Plan couldn't).  I called Customer Service first, and Paige was very rude, and even said LOL, mocking me. I spoke to Lori, our Sale Rep, she could care less. The transaction was done and her commission was made. I spoke to the sales Manager, Ashley, and she was just was rude. The finally straw was when I spoke to the Store Manager, Fred. He is a man of excuses. He did nothing to satisfy a long time customer, he was just as rude as everyone else I spoke to, and I can see who is setting the example for Customer Service at the Ontario location. He refused to do anything to help, except extend our store credit and even said he didn't have time for our conversation and hung up on me. There was no accountability for what I was told by the multiple other people before this.  The FPP company said it was up to the discretion of Mathis, on how they wanted to proceed. I honestly think Mathis brothers isn't honoring their warranty, and they are upset at FFP for issuing a store credit.

If you are choosing to shop here be aware of how you will be treated and talked to after you purchase from them. They were nice in the beginning and lie to get the sale. So disappointed in them as a whole, and they did a great job of ruining my holiday.

Side note: Delivery people were rude, didn't wear shoe coverings and damaged one of my items.<//text>

< Text>
Gigantic store with name-brand merchandise spanning medium to higher-end price points. They even have their own cafe. I was impressed with their selection of name brands. You won't find low quality junk like they have at Bob's, Mor, and similar discount stores. They also offer design services. Shopped for a sofa and loveseat, which were priced about 10% lower than other stores for the same item. Salespeople are friendly but will keep asking if you have questions if you try to look around on your own. Four stars since I don't know what their service is like after a sale, buy definitely worth a look.<//Text>

< review>
SSpent $15,000 on Furniture at Mathis for our new home. Dining room set, and 2 sets of sofas for 2 rooms. Great customer service until we placed our last order which happened to be a special order.  We placed a special order for a sofa sectional on July 4th weekend. Rubin our sales man told us 3 months for delivery. Within a week of the purchase we determined that the sofas were too bulky for the room and I called Rubin after less than a week from the purchase to change the order to smaller sofas and he refused stating that the order was already in fabrication.  Seriously, it takes 3 months to make it and couldn't change it after less than a week. Well, the Sofas were delivered 2 days ago, and good enough, they were so bulky for our small family room.  What an eye sore.  In the showroom they looked so good, as the show room is so huge, we couldn't tell.  I just called Rubin again, pleading with him to take it back with penalties, restocking fees, 10-20% fee, etc, etc... whatever it takes to have Mathis take them back.  He said no because it's a special order.  Now we are stuck with a $2,800 eye sore for many years.  Very sad.
I came to find out that this place is not about customer satisfaction, they simply don't care. They are too big to find someone to talk to who would care or to give you any personalized service if you have an issue. Your sales man is your only contact, and they are already trained on what to say: a quick NO. They are all over you until you complete the sale, then they leave you hanging.  Rubin kept texting me the contract saying look you signed it, it says here non-refundable, seriously Mathis? this is how you treat customers who came to you with their hard earned cash at challenging times like this.  You have a huge clearance room for discounted furniture, you cannot charge me a return penalty fee and put it in that showroom, to resolve a customer issue?  This issue might not mean much to you, but to me and my family, a purchase like this is a really big deal.
So Customers be ware and be 100 percent sure before you buy here, they have great furniture but their return policy is extremely stringent, they will not bend, they will enforce every word on that contract once you sign it,  and to me that's very prohibitive, we are human, who doesn't make mistakes. Live and learn.</review>
<Pictures>None<//Pictures>< Response>
{'time': 1602426573699, 'text': "Al, We apologize for any inconvenience you are having with the furniture you selected. We apologize if the details of the contract were not explained to you in explicit detail before you signed for the order and we will be notifying Store Management about your review to encourage additional training so customers are well aware before signing a Special Order Agreement. We appreciate your business."}<//Response>

< Review>
The sales associate, Lawrence Jenkins from the Ontario location was outstanding! Five stars for Lawrence. He was attentive, answered all our questions and very helpful.

However the reason for the 3 star rating is based on the customer pick-up service. We arranged to pick up the furniture directly from the store vs delivery service, after purchasing the furniture a month beforehand.

I even called the day of pick up to verify the furniture was available & ready for pickup, which it was. My husband had to wait almost 3 hours for the furniture to be retrieved and brought out. Worst experience ever! See letter to general manager
Fred,

My name is Chris . My wife and I bought a pair of bunk beds for our children and a dresser 3 weeks ago. We only purchased these items from Mathis Brothers as we were told they were both available in your inventory and all other furniture stores had a back order of roughly two weeks due to Covid. One bunk bed for my daughter went in with no problems although the very tired and unmasked delivery men thought for the first couple hours they had lost the ladder and continued to ask us for beverages. We determined the the 2nd bunk bed was missing the slats and were unable to assemble the bed.

When we contacted the store they apologized for the oversight and told us to come down the next day to pick up the slats. When my mother in law got there she was told to go to 3 different departments within the store and then was given slats to a king size bed not the full size required for the bed.

We waited another week for Mathis Brothers to find the additional set and we were invited to drive to your distribution center again only to find out the slats once again did not fit the bed. This time around we found out this was due to the bed being built incorrectly.

Today we were supposed to have a new bed delivered between 2-4 PM so I took the afternoon off work to make sure this was done correctly and my 4 year old son would have a bed to sleep in tonight. We were told by your drivers when they showed up they did not have the bed in the truck. I called your office who assured me they did but now the driver was too far to return and the next delivery would be Friday. After reluctantly agreeing to the delivery I received a message from your corporate office stating this bed would be out of stock until September.

<Name>Bootsie Battle-Holt</Name>< review>
I wish I had come to this site before my purchase and read all of the ONE STAR reviews. I cannot believe this company has the nerve to continue to treat customers with such disrespect.
I am a recent widow who purchased a new couch for sentimental reasons after my husband passed away on our old couch. Now, I have been waiting for a couch from MB for 2 1/2 months. Every time I call for an update, they give me a different delivery date and a different person who is my "sales manager." Every time, they promise a certain date and every time that date comes and goes without anyone contacting me. This is very frustrating as I got rid of my old couch when they promised the first delivery date, and now my family and I have nothing in that spot as we get yanked around time and time again.
In the meantime, we have purchased other furniture for bedrooms and Mathis has lost out on a lot of business from us. If they could only be honest and reputable and offer something other than lies, they would have had our additional business and I would not be inclined to go all over the internet and tell everyone about our HORRIBLE experience.  This is my first review and I plan to go to many more sites to share while we wait for some action on this situation.

Although this store has many mattresses and furniture to purchase, I would be very careful. They do not do returns on mattresses, pillows, sheets, comforters, and mattress protection products. After speaking with sales associate, Maria Ramirez, I was told to check for defects immediately upon receiving my mattress. This is exactly what my husband and I did. We found that the mattress was defective and even though we spoke to the store manager, they refused to allow us to refund or exchange the mattress despite defects. This is very disappointing and I would not recommend purchasing mattresses from here. I would especially be weary of the workers here because in order to get warranty and return/exchange benefits, you need to purchase additional items on top of your order.</Text>

I wish I had come to this site before my purchase and read all of the ONE STAR reviews. I cannot believe this company has the nerve to continue to treat customers with such disrespect.
I am a recent widow who purchased a new couch for sentimental reasons after my husband passed away on our old couch. Now, I have been waiting for a couch from MB for 2 1/2 months. Every time I call for an update, they give me a different delivery date and a different person who is my "sales manager." Every time, they promise a certain date and every time that date comes and goes without anyone contacting me. This is very frustrating as I got rid of my old couch when they promised the first delivery date, and now my family and I have nothing in that spot as we get yanked around time and time again.
In the meantime, we have purchased other furniture for bedrooms and Mathis has lost out on a lot of business from us. If they could only be honest and reputable and offer something other than lies, they would have had our additional business and I would not be inclined to go all over the internet and tell everyone about our HORRIBLE experience.  This is my first review and I plan to go to many more sites to share while we wait for some action on this situation.

< review>
Very disappointed.  After an amazing previous experience this go around was a big let down.  I have spent housands of dollars from the Ontario location buying their high end furniture and I intended to furnish my whole house with them.  Bought an A.R.T gables cal king bed which I was told was in stock and was even given a scheduled delivery date.  I called them on the eve of the delivery since I thought I would have received a time window by then, only to be nonchalantly told my bed will be delivered when the rest of my order becomes available.  Huh?  No communication no apology, just matter of fact take it or leave it attitude.  Mind you, this is different to what I was told in person at the store.  Off to find a store with good customer service even if it means paying a bit more.  It is a pity  because their sales folks are amazing.

Update: After a lot of communication back and forth, cancelations, re-order and re-cancellations I finally contacted their Irvine branch with much better results.  I got my bed and love it so far.  Now I need the matching nightstands (should cost around $3000 for the 2, what can u say i love A.R.T furniture) and came back to read reviews . With some recent reviews mimicking my experience there, namely  great sales rep and horrible delivery experience, I am very reluctant to buy.  MATHIS brothers can you bring back the management team you had back in early to mid 2019? I don't know if management changed but I know for sure the customer care quality have dropped. <rate>1<//rate>< review>
Our experience with Mathis Brothers has been terrible. Here is a timeline of events:
1. We bought our couch on Sunday, June 16. We were told it would be delivered on Monday, June 17. We were so excited! This was one of our first major furniture purchases as husband and wife.
2. Monday, the couch arrives and it is the wrong one. We tell the deliverers and they take a picture. We also call Mathias to report the issue, and they don't seem to believe us. They ask us to take pictures to confirm the issue. The first time the pictures did not go through. We had to resend them.
3. On Tuesday, we call back and get told that yes, we were given the wrong couch and that the correct one would be delivered on Friday.
4. Friday comes along, and we haven't heard from Mathias about a delivery time. We call. Apparently the couch is out of stock and more will be delivered to the location sometime next week (they do not have a date). Mathis never called to tell us this that the delivery time changed, we had to follow up ourselves.
All the salesmen talked about the whole time we were looking for a couch at their location was about their excellent record with costumer service. However, this has not been our experience. Mathias has not communicated sufficiently with us and our problem remains unsolved with no end to this nightmare in sight.
The selection is good and the salesmen will talk a mean game, but if you run into an actual problem, do not expect it to be solved in a timely manner or receive any support.
UPDATE: We went back to the store and have now been told that it will be at least 4 weeks before our couch arrives. Again, Mathis never told us this until we hunted them down for answers.<//review>

< Text>
The short story:
Run! This store will only teach you that price and quality are not related. They sell cheaply made and low quality furniture for high prices. What good is a somewhat good looking sofa in a dumpster?

The details:
A $2332.95 sofa which was on clearance (19% off) did not even make it to be used once.
There is no return or even warranty because it was on clearance. Customer service is so rude and unhelpful, you feel like you bought a 200$ sofa online and they are wondering what you expected for the price.
The funny thing, the online store would take the sofa back, repair it and be somewhat polite.
This store is the best example to why retail is dying.</Text>

<text>Extremely disappointed in Mathis Brothers and a shocking experience I had with one of their customer service reps. Short version: I have a gift card for Mathis Brothers that I've been unable to use, and the customer rep who was trying to "help" me, Lenora Thomas, simply hung up the phone on me while I was trying to resolve the issue.

Longer version of the story: I recently received a $200 gift card from my parents for my birthday. As there is currently a pandemic locking down much of the country, I decided to shop online for my Mathis Brothers product to spend my gift certificate on. Once I found the item and tried to check out, I was surprised to see that I could not use my gift card on the website (pretty surprising for any business these days). All the same I contacted customer service, and I received a very prompt reply from Lenora Thomas via text. She instructed me to email her photos of my gift card so she could process my order. I found this very unusual, but I followed the instructions. She then asked what I was hoping to order. I told her the lamp I wanted to buy. Then she said she would call me the next day. I never received a call. I texted asking if there was a good time to talk. She simply told me they couldn't find my account number and therefore couldn't help me. I did not know what this meant, so I tried calling her back a few times. I finally got through. Lenora told me she couldn't allow me to use my gift card and that I had to go into a store. I found this surprising and unusual (I live 2 hours away from the nearest store and wasn't even sure if they were open during lockdown). I asked if we could simply complete the order over the phone or online. She refused. I asked to speak to the manager. She left, appeared to ask her manager something, then returned and said I'd need to visit a store. I told her I lived a couple hours away from the nearest store and was hoping to complete my order some other way. After refusing to help me further, I asked to speak with her manager. She refused then hung up on me. I was shocked and disappointed. I can't believe this is how Mathis Brothers treats there customers.
I was simply looking forward to spending my gift money from my parents on an item at Mathis Brothers, but now it doesn't even seem like I'm able to do that and my $200 has gone to waste. I'm sad and so are my parents because they were looking forward to seeing what I would purchase. This has left such a bad taste in my mouth, and I'm sad to say I will be steering everyone I know away from Mathis Brothers in the future.
If anyone from Mathis Brothers does read this, I'm still hoping to put my gift card to use.</text><date>1590784443461< /date>< Response>
{'time': 1590938415883, 'text': "Blake - We're disappointed to hear that you have had a bad experience trying to purchase online. I apologize for the issues you've had. If it's a paper giftcard, those need to be brought in the store because there is not a card number, so there's no way to track it. It's more of a gift certificate. If you could let us know which type you have, we will do all we can to help you! You can email us at GoogleMBF@mathisbrothers.com. Thank you."}</Response>

We found chairs that seem to be good quality for the price. We specifically asked about delivery charges and communicated the city we live in.  We were told $99 for both chairs.  During the checkout process the salesperson said something about joining  a delivery service membership for $69 to get a delivery discount. We declined because it was our first purchase there and didn‚Äôt know if we would be back. After checkout we discovered we were charged significantly more and questioned the person at the concierge desk located by the front door.  We were told delivery was actually $149 plus 3% of purchase price.  He told us we had to join the membership to get the $99 delivery.  Say what???  The delivery charges are high and the process  is very deceptive. Adding three percent to the overall cost is just a sneaky way of charging a higher price after the sale is made. < review>
At first everything was great. However, later I realized I had been told false information. Andrea made it seem like by purchasing the $69.99 platinum membership that my furniture would be delivered and assembled, plus I would be getting 4% cash back. Later after I paid, she informed me it isn‚Äôt cash back, but 4% back in points. She acted like it was the same thing as the $99.99 delivery fee except you actually get more for less. This of course is not true, as I realized after the fact, days later, that my furniture would be left at the lobby of my apartment building and not be assembled for me. Andrea saw me, and knew good and well that there was no way I could carry and assemble heavy furniture up 4 floors. It makes no sense that she wouldn‚Äôt be upfront about the membership only getting you threshold delivery when I would have paid the full delivery fee to have it assembled. She also made it as if I would be getting my box spring for $100, but since it was a king, she failed to add two box springs. She only put one. Luckily the delivery driver recognized this and fixed the issue for me. Andrea‚Äôs failure to convey the proper information regarding my purchase is what will keep me from returning to Mathis Brothers in the future. That and the customer service when I called making it my fault and mansplaining to me that it states on my receipt that it would be a threshold delivery and not assembly. Just because it‚Äôs on the receipt does not mean that the sales person did their job adequately explaining what you are paying for. The only reason I decided to give 2 stars instead of 1 is because the delivery guys were so great and professional. Mark was sure to make sure all of my needs were met, and even helped me arrange my furniture in the room as efficiently as possible. When a rail was smashed, he was very upfront and was sure to get it exchanged for me as quickly as possible. Mathis should really consider doing some proper sales training for their employees. As the faces of the company, they should be doing everything to keep customers and not just make a sale in the moment.</review>

0x80c33577d03fc169:0x50877c0484aa9131< /Gmap_id>

< text>
Initially I had a great shopping experience.  I really enjoyed going into the store and I was always greeted warmly by the salespeople.

I had heard and was apprehensive that they only wanted to make a sale.  They were always respectful of my time when I was only "window-shopping."

When the day came that I was finally ready to make a very large multi room purchase, the sales person I was dealing with was very excited that I gave him my business.

This sales person turned out however to be very disappointing.  He was on the next visit too busy with an active customer to even check in with me.  I waited 45 minutes and he never responded to any of his three pages.  I used a nice junior salesman who was working in the clearance section.

My Mathis brother's experience only got worse when I had to wait several weeks for delivery due to a problem with billing and or shipping as they never called me to tell me that my order could be delivered.

The head Manager, Dan made thing better and took some of the sting out of the bad experience by offering to give me free shipping which I gladly accepted.

Dan still know what the customer experience means and he did go out of his way to make things right.

Dan gets five stars *****.</text>

We bought a power recycling sofa and chair made by lazy boy in 2017 from mathis furniture. We bought the extended warranty that the salesman said would take care of any problems for 3 years. On November 15 my chair made a big bang when raising the foot rest and immediately  the foot rest fell down.  The next day we called Mathis brothers  and asked to have someone come and repair the chair,they said they would have to schedule someone to come out and we would receive a call,1 week later we got a call and scheduled a repairman for a Saturday and they would call with a time,well he showed up at 9 am without calling,he was here for maybe 5 minutes and said he had to order a part. We waited 10 days and did not here back so I called customer service to find out the problem and was told it could take anywhere from 6 to 10 weeks to get the part at which time I said this was unacceptable and they should provide me with a new chair,the girl I was speaking with said she would have a representative  call me as soon as she got off the other line,well 4 hours later I finally called back and got the runaround  again and finally 2 hours after that she finally called back and said that this is covered under the manufacturer's  warranty and there is nothing more they can do and I will have to wait.i think wainting anywhere from 2 to 3 months to use my chair is unacceptable  and they should replace it.</Text>

<user_id>105700767318507726353< /user_id>< Review>
Initially I had a great shopping experience.  I really enjoyed going into the store and I was always greeted warmly by the salespeople.

I had heard and was apprehensive that they only wanted to make a sale.  They were always respectful of my time when I was only "window-shopping."

When the day came that I was finally ready to make a very large multi room purchase, the sales person I was dealing with was very excited that I gave him my business.

This sales person turned out however to be very disappointing.  He was on the next visit too busy with an active customer to even check in with me.  I waited 45 minutes and he never responded to any of his three pages.  I used a nice junior salesman who was working in the clearance section.

My Mathis brother's experience only got worse when I had to wait several weeks for delivery due to a problem with billing and or shipping as they never called me to tell me that my order could be delivered.

The head Manager, Dan made thing better and took some of the sting out of the bad experience by offering to give me free shipping which I gladly accepted.

Dan still know what the customer experience means and he did go out of his way to make things right.

Dan gets five stars *****.<//Review>

<review>First of all sorry for the long review, but it was very frustrating FYI check your receipts carefully! We purchased a sectional with recliners, while we were shopping the salesman said there was an extra module in the clearance that someone had returned. At first, he did not tell us the piece was not working. So when we asked then they were honest and said no it does not work, but hey thought it was the switch not the motor, but for $50dollars why not buy the extra piece and try to fix it. So upon check out the cashier messed up our total 3x, we spent over 30 minutes trying to get the total; no offense but she was using the calculator and her 3inch nails kept pushing the wrong keys and she kept starting over. Anyways, that was not the end as we were driving home I looked over the receipt again and it was still wrong. So I called and they fixed it. When the sectional was delivered one piece was not working (and not the one we bought) it kept clicking so we called them the next day they offered to exchange it. At this point I became skeptical about this couch considering there was a piece in the clearance not working and now our brand new piece. Plus there is no warranty on the motor. So I asked if I could return it for the main  reason that I no longer felt secure that I was getting something that would last me long. Also I was not satisfied with the appearance of the sectional in our living room. They said they would take it back, but I would have to get something equal or greater value or else I  would be charged the restocking fee and pick up fee. Mind you this furniture had been in my home less than 24hrs.  So we purchased a different set and once again the cashier was a disaster. No lie she gave me 4 different totals. The totals ranged from a $900 dollar to $330 in difference. They kept trying to tax me twice and charge me restocking fee.  She  finally got it right after having to confirm with a supervisor.  The cashier problem did not end there. The salesman kept telling my husband about the "great" furniture protection plan, so they said we could add it before it was delivered. So my husband called the night before delivery and once again he was told he would have to pay more than they originally told us, than they placed him on hold for over 25 minutes so he hung up.  They called me after my husband hung up and their story was that the protection plan would now be $290, someone else had told my husband it was over  $300. We were over all the problems and just wanted the furniture delivered so we opted out of the plan.  Now delivery time was not as promised it was a day later and the time of arrival was 2hrs later than promised. We finally got our couches and they are nice. What a headache,  I expect if you spend over $3,000 you should at least come out a little more satisfied and with a happier story. Buyer beware and pay attention to the total on your receipts, especially if you are financing with them.</review><Resp>{'time': 1542640827718, 'text': 'Hi Silvia- We apologize about the multiple issues you experienced with this purchase. < review>
We went to Mathis Brothers in Ontario, CA which is about an hour away from our house to see if there was anything different from the normal furniture stores in our area (Temecula, CA).  We were fortunate to hook up with the sales person Ms. Priscilla Yam.  Priscilla took very good care of us.  We didn't know exactly what style of furniture we were looking for, just that we wanted a change.  She is/was extremely patient as we changed our minds several times.  She accommodated our delivery and return once the furniture got to the house and wasn't quite what we wanted once it got in our house.  She spent time sending us photos of furniture she thought would go well with our decor so we could see it before making the long trip out there.  She did this time and time again until we finally locked in with the style of furniture to fit our styled.  She is/was amazing.  Never pushy, just a very good listener and flexible.  We ended up spending thousands of dollars on almost every room in our house and it turned out amazing.  We are extremely pleased with the quality of furniture and personal yet professional care we received from Ms. Priscilla Yam.  She truly made our Mathis Brothers experience great!  We'd definitely refer our friends and family to Mathis Brothers and Priscilla Yam.< /review>

<Pictures>None</Pictures><gmap_id>0x80c33577d03fc169:0x50877c0484aa9131</gmap_id><user>112508799890549144282</user>< Review>
Our Sales Associate, Van Mai, was very patient with my elderly mother and her friend. He led them to each of the departments they were interested in and did it at a pace that was comfortable for them. He did not push them into buying something they were not interested in but allowed them to weigh the pros and cons, walk back and forth between their favorite items and answer all their questions.
My mother was very pleased that she did not feel pressured into making her purchase. On top of that, Van stayed longer than his scheduled time to take care of them.
The delivery went smoothly. We received a two hour window the day before the delivery and the driver called us ten minutes out. They were polite, careful and quick.
All in all, I would recommend Mathis Brothers to anyone who asked. I wish we had one in Ohio!< /Review>

< Review>
Of course the sales people are always nice Because they want their commission. The experience with the sales representative was OK. After they took my money for a custom order sofa set, it took 4 weeks to get delivered to their Warehouse, drove two hours to pick up the furniture only to discover the sofa was damaged. They offered a discount if I took the sofa as is. I refused. They suggested I keep the sofa as a loaner, due to the fact I had to wait another 4 weeks for the new one.. I waited, my sales rep called me to tell me my sofa was in and they would deliver it. Delivery time was 4:30-6:30. The delivery guys called me at 3:40 and told me he would be their in 20 min... I explained to him that my delivery time was at 4:30. He said he would wait 15 min. I got to my neighborhood at 4:38, called him. No answer.. saw a Mathis delivery truck making a u turn, I pulled up next to him and told him, I just called you.  He said he rescheduled the delivery for another day, I need to call customer service. At this point he was 1.5 miles from my house and customers have a 15 min grace period is what he told me on the phone... Mathis Brothers furniture will never get my business again! <gmap_id>0x80c33577d03fc169:0x50877c0484aa9131</gmap_id><review>Desiring against spending countless hours traversing from one imitation furniture store to the next I elected upon saving us both the headache & going DIRECTLY to the source.

Ya' see...., most places sell furniture in bulk (sofa, 2 end tables, an area rug,...blah blah blahhhh) & then upcharge when securing payment for their price of delivery.....even if you're just a mile or two away & ain't nobody got time for added lumbar struggles!

"Reclining" on Inland Empire Blvd., this 45,000 sq. ft. sofa, sectional & EVERYTHING in the middle "mausoleum" is the largest of its kind around & facilitates around the mantra, "if we ain't got it, then you either don't need it OR it simply doesn't diddly' darned exist!"

Wow. Such confidence.

Driving out just a few days ago, we were greeted by an ear-to-ear smiling "Orie O."

(Yup, that's REALLY her name)

Providing us with the royal tour did I wish I'd worn more comfortable shoes. Man. These guys have EVERYTHING!

From sofas, to sectionals, to love seats to dining sets down to bedroom furniture, mirrors, lighting & area rugs.

Not only do they price match by 200% (see the attached photo from their website) but they've got brand upon brand to pretty much appease everyone; from the big ballers & shot callers to those with lint balls & last year's casino vouchers aligning their pocketbook!

Yazzzzzz!

There was NO PRESSURE to purchase any undesired side items that we neither needed nor wanted.

Perhaps the ONLY pressure that we actually observed was very well wafted by way of our newfound sales driven compadre, who'd randomly pop up from outta' nowhere like that weird neighbor you shut your blinds on!

*~~~*~~~*~~~*

"I ALWAYS feel likkkke... SOMEBODY'S wattttching meeeee!"

*~~~*~~~*~~~*

Similar to the flatulence derived upon by consuming dairy products, I wish I'd downed a tray of gouda beforehand just to better enable us to shop in peace!

*** "I'm not going to follow you guys around. I'll leave you to explore the store on your own." ***

Then, whyyyyyy are you still there lurking within the trenches like a 5 o'clock shadow, Craigggg???!

So, why 3 stars as opposed to 5, Kenny?

Well grab hold of your bar stools and I'll tell you!

Upon finalizing our order of 2 Simon Li sofas we proceeded to purchase 2 (of 6 total) bar stools to match up with our recently installed hardwood.

No sense in purchasing them all at once when there's no guarantee they're going to even look right, right?

Requesting they be unwrapped & assembled as suggested REPEATEDLY by this Orie, we paid &-

* GET THIS...

....became INSTANTLY enlightened by way of the store manager that THEY DON'T ASSEMBLE FURNITURE WITHIN THE AFTERNOONS (because there's no one there to do it) & that this process requires "prior approval" from Mgmt as is.

*** Whacha' say, whacha' say now?

Soooooo, you mean to tell me that you've STALKED us for the better portion of 2 hours w/o even offering us dinner & a movie and didn't so much as perform a simple fact check PRIOR to "checking us out"?

Way to go guys!

You made the sell. Was it worth it?!!

If I hadn't known better, I'd swear we'd entered Bass Pro Shops because certainly this BLATANT "bait & switch" couldn't possibly be sold along with the stain guard & extended warranties by way of dissa' here furniture store!

But I ain't done!

We were then driven to retrieve said boxes from a LESS THAN STELLAR pick up/delivery crew (opposite side of the store) whereas we returned home just to "channel" IKEA through the usage of Allen wrenches, boxed wine & caption-less instructional photos.

Smfh.

This is blatant b/s & no doubt will we be returning these stools like an unwanted box of expired holiday stuffing!

If anything, I'm going to humbly advocate Orie O. opt for a prompt pseudonym swap.

No doubt, after we dished out $1,000's while viewing her visibly "write a check w/ her mouth that her behind clearly could NOT cash", upon succumbing to our impromptu DIY session, how about going with "Nabisco", darling?

Caus' dealing with you,.....I betcha' bite a "gyp"!</review></record></dataset><record>

< Text>
Our Sales Associate, Van Mai, was very patient with my elderly mother and her friend. He led them to each of the departments they were interested in and did it at a pace that was comfortable for them. He did not push them into buying something they were not interested in but allowed them to weigh the pros and cons, walk back and forth between their favorite items and answer all their questions.

We have purchased furniture from this store previously.  The store is very clean, great showrooms and good selection.   Recently, we purchased some items that were defective.  When I called the store for the replacement, the person was nice and said they would replace the item with no problems. We had quite an experience just getting the store to update our new address in their system  which I addressed with the sales person at the time of the purchase. A month later, we finally get the replacement piece of furniture and it turns out the new unit is worse than the one it replaced. We are at the point of returning all of the furniture we purchased.  We are very disappointed with our latest shopping experience at this store.

I called the store 2 days ago, left a message for the store manager with my order number, I have yet to hear from anyone with Mathis Brothers.  While the social media rep responded to my review, it appears that no one from the store has taken the initiative to resolve the matter.  Perhaps the social media repsonse is the way say they are responsive.  I understand it might be a busy time of the year but how long does one have to wait to get things resolved?< /review>

<Review>Just wow! What a great experience. We have to admit that Mathis Brothers wasn't on our list to shop- the only reason we went was because my phone suggested it (so I guess some of its data-mining is used for good, lol)
Roya met us at the door, and at first we thought she'd be like the sales people we'd already dealt with, but she quickly distinguished herself by knowing exactly what we were looking for, telling us what we needed and then leaving us alone to talk it out and make up our minds. She even showed us the clearance room, since we only wanted a couch & chair, just in case we could find what we needed there. That's confidence!

We were leaning towards another set at another store, and Mathis was more expensive. Or so we thought. The price tags on Mathis' pieces was straightforward. The "other" place had high prices but with 50% off. But not the Mgrs. Specials, or 'select' pieces, etc.

So we told Roya we were going back to the other store to see if they could really do the 50% we were told, and Roya gave us her card, told us to call her if we decided to go with Mathis, and then we could do it all by phone, saving us a trip back.

As it turns out the "other" store (starts with a "A") shot themselves in the foot, first, by not actually being able to do the 50%- in fact we are still confused by the salesperson's math- but mostly by BADMOUTHING Mathis Brothers. Even after I showed the salesperson the couch & chair we liked, she told me my choice was unattractive.

So we called Roya on our way out of the parking lot, we had everything wrapped up by the time we got home and our beautiful reclining sofa & big comfy chair were delivered within 24 hours.  The delivery guys were clean, friendly & efficient.

Mathis Brothers and especially Roya- THANK YOU!</Review>< Pics>

Mathis Brothers should get it together. Even though the salesman and delivery men were very courteous, our experience of purchasing a bedroom set for our young son was just shy of terrible. < Review>
Honestly I had a poor experience with them. The day I walked in on December 8, 2018 no one greeted me, nor did anyone come help me when asked. My aunt met me at the Ontario location and walked in and said the same thing of no one greeted her but helped people around her. Finally after walking around and Sitting on a few couches someone walked by and said hi are you finding everything ok, I said honestly you‚Äôre the first person to acknowledge us. He said I‚Äôm very sorry about that, I‚Äôll help you. My aunt explained that we‚Äôre looking for a couch, one for me and one for her. He was very helpful at that point. We continued walking and looking until I found a couch that called my name. I was told that I can customize the fabric so I asked if someone can help me with that process. So he called the designer Jasmine who was very very helpful the entire way. The original associate was no where to be found but I had no idea that was our last encounter. We looked at fabric and put together the perfect couch for me. I was extremely happy, signed the papers, paid a down payment and even bought an amazing rug to go with it. I received a message on December 26, 2018 that my fabric has been discontinued and that I had to come in and choose another. Now my entire thought process and accents bought elsewhere were out the window because nothing matched it. I went back into the store on the 28th all the way from Los Angeles. And settled for a fabric I wasn‚Äôt happy with for the entire couch and pillows because the company discontinued all of the other options for the couch. My thought was why were they still up there if the customer choosing it would be disappointed as myself. So we walked around again and I found a pillow that I fell in love with, as I picked it up I was stabbed by an open pin hiding in the zipper. I gave it to a manager and we made a report just in case anything happened. <Rate>3<//Rate>< Review>
I have been a customer of Mathis Bros for over five years.  My purchases include bedroom and living room furniture.  The sales associates have always been friendly and helpful as well as the employees in the pickup area.  My problem recently is with the furniture protection department.  I purchased the furniture protection for my couch and after four years needed a stain removal.  They sent someone out promptly.  However, they did not re-spray it with the stain protector and now after almost a year the stain is coming back to the surface.  I called the furniture protection and advised them of the issue and the customer service representative was very rude. <review>We bought about $12K worth of brand name furniture from Mathis after doing our homework and realized that their prices are very competitive.

We check local in state, out of state, internet sellers and at the end, Mathis prices were competitive.  The other advantage of buying from Mathis is that they had all of the pieces in stock VS any other place we  went to, we had to wait for 6-8 weeks.

Our sales person was Roya was great and she was a joy to work with. (Not pushy).  We went to the store 3 times till we made the purchase. Overall great experience and we will buy again.

<name>Sabiha Sharma< /name><time>1471559091920</time><Rate>2</Rate>< Review>
The store representative at the Ontario store, Angelica was extremely helpful. However, you cannot request a delivery time so you are at the disposal of the delivery company. When the delivery people got to our place, they noticed that the bed frame was damaged, which makes me wonder if they check the furniture condition before loading it in their truck. The delivery guy kept suggesting to me how I can fix it and I should take the delivery anyways. I live alone so when I asked for help to move the futon which was already there, they refused to help me! I just thought that was a bit rude, the customer service told me that I shouldn't waste their time and if I upset that the delivery team cannot move my futon to accommodate my new bed then I should go ahead and cancel the order. She was extremely unhelpful!
As a customer who loves your inventory selection but is hesitant to shop there again- I highly suggest you add an option where the delivery company can help move old furniture. I am sure anyone who needs help will be willing to sign a waiver for it. Also, please train your phone staff to be more polite. There job is to answer customer calls - why would she refer to it as a "waste of time".< /Review>

<rate>3<//rate>< Text>
We were recommended to check them out from close friends.  Obviously their furniture quality is awesome, can't really beat it.  Their salespeople are cordial and overall professional.
Unfortunately, we had some major issues with shipping/delivery and overall scheduling that really soured our experience with them.  We had ordered a couch that we were told would take 8-12 weeks to deliver (due to customization); we also ordered a bedroom set. We were told a certain date for delivery for the bedroom set; when my wife called to check the date, it was later then initially told during the time of sale; we were also (without asking) told an earlier date of delivery for the couch than initially told. Long story short, we got our entire bedroom set later than told and had no idea when the couch was coming. This made out to be a frustrating and slightly stressful situation. As of this writing we have our entire set and the couch (arrived around the ten week mark; the issue was we were told different dates). Also, the couch is missing a hook to connect to another piece so now a technician needs to come out to install that (have not received a call for this). We did go in a discuss with one of the managers of the situation; we were told one of the shipping companies they're contracted with went bankrupt; so maybe this was an unfortunate time, but as a consumer who has paid, I did expect more.  The manager also never contacted us to update us as we were told.
Will we shop there again? Yes, probably, because we still need a few pieces; I am hoping this next time goes over smoother; otherwise, we'll have to look at smaller, private furniture companies.  I do want to add they sent a $250 certificate; not sure if this is standard or done for the inconvenience. Here's hoping for a better shipping experience.< /Text>

I have purchased furniture and was advised to get furniture insurance. Beware I was charged twice and had to fight to get my refund. Now 2 years later I put in a claim and they state they cannot honor their agreement because it is not accidental. The insurance is fraud they do not tell you the insurance is through a third party. They do not stand behind what is written on paper or flyer. The sale personal tell you something different than customer service. Do not believe what they tell you ...lying is their business. Furniture falls apart within 2 years insurance or not.... Their customer service is non existent...Do not buy from this company.You will regret your decision. If you do Do Not get Extended Warranty. Check your reciept before you leave to ensure no mistakes or overcharges. Not an honest company.</review>

< text>
Our salesperson, Marta, went above and beyond good service.  While in the Ontario store, we needed another chair to replace the defective recliner that we had purchased (with fabric protection plan).  I had mentioned to Marta that I was wondering about warranty coverage since it was the chair padding that was the issue.  We immediately went to Customer Service, after explaining the situation was given store credit.  We used the store credit and had a new (different name brand) recliner delivered and the old one returned.  The folks at Mathis Bros definitely earned our 5 Star rating!< /text>

<rate>1< /rate><Text>I NEVER do reviews but my experience has made me so upset that I believe they should receive one star. They told me I would receive my product in 3 days and in 2 weeks I had to call back on the status and was told it was back ordered until May 22nd. Then I called to confirm on Monday and was told that it wouldn't be in until June 2nd. That is when I was transferred to my original sales person where he told me that the bed set would not be in until July. By now I was extremely frustrated so he suggested that they could sell me the floor model at a 10% discount only to find out that the manufacturer would not approve it. So the next solution was shipping me a bed from the OKC store and it would take 3 weeks. So I said why wouldn't this have been an option 3 weeks ago when you knew the bed set was back ordered and the only response was that the manager had to make that decision. Fast forward to the next morning where my sales person called me to say that miraculously they had the bed in stock. Now this meant 2 things in my opinion... they were selling me the floor model without the discount or were giving me someone else's bed. Neither one was a great option. So I came to the decision to get my furniture from another store. I am really not an unreasonable person, a phone call to inform me of the back ordered would have changed this entire outcome but the lack of communication was dismal. I truly can't believe they would let this happen. Sooo if you are looking to buy here then save the time and DON'T.< /Text>< Date>

< review>
Our experience with Mathis Bros was amazing.  We have been looking for over a year for a large coffee table.  When we finally discovered Mathis Bros we were delighted for have several tables to choose from.  Ricky, our salesperson, was very helpful and stayed with us until we signed the paperwork and left the store.

The item we wanted was not on the floor so he took us to the warehouse next door.  The box was delivered within minutes, unpacked for our inspection and we decided the table was exactly what we were looking for.  He walked us to the cashier, who greeted us by name and had the paperwork ready for our payment and signature.    They apologized that it would be 2 days before they could deliver the table.  TWO DAYS!  We live in south Orange County and expected it would be 2 weeks!

We received an email  before we returned home that day reminding us of the delivery day and time.  On the delivery day we received an email reminder three hours before the delivery and then a phone call 30 minutes before they arrived.  The table base had already been assembled so the delivery took about 10 minutes.  The delivery men were courteous and efficient.

If all companies were run like Mathis Bros furniture shopping would be such a pleasure!  We will definitely be back for all our future purchases.

Than You!!
Sandy & Don Rickner< /review>

<rate>4< /rate>< Review>
In terms of variety choice and quality this place is fantastic. It's like a furniture Mall, it's so freaking huge.

Although it's all the way in Ontario, I made the trip from LA because I just needed more choices to pick from and they do have same day delivery and their warehouse is right next door so often most of the things are in stock. However be prepared to pay for a delivery fee if you're not nearby, I had to pay 90 bucks for my $1,300 couch and it was delivered at the time they estimated.

I left off one star because the sales people here are just on you like flys on shi* and they constantly follow you throughout the store until you finally tell them you're not interested or when you're finally interested. Our guy was nice but again I just don't like people looming around me well I'm trying to figure out what I want. <resp>{'time': 1478114000468, 'text': 'Thanks Judi!'}< /resp></record></dataset><record>
<gmapID>0x80c33577d03fc169:0x50877c0484aa9131< /gmapID><pics>None<//pics><Text>We went shopping for bedroom sets.  We were looking for Hooker brand furniture and after doing research on where to find retailers.  All the fingers pointed here.

At first you walk in and your overwhelmed by the grandeur size of this place!  Its HUGE!  They have an entire rug section.  Living room set-ups throughout the entire warehouse size establishment flooded the ground floor. Even an entire section of outdoor furniture sets too! Everything is well placed and organized.  Lots and lots of furniture.  Very nice stuff too.

But... unless you like to be accompanied by a used car salesman while you explore an all to be desired shopping experience.  After your greeted at the entrance, I suggest you move quickly to the front desk and immediately file a restraining order.  That mother f'er will cling to you like a 22 year old hopeless romantic female with no dad looking for love.  They are Hungry!!!  They will fight for you... They will knife each other in the back for you.  Hell, they will spit each other in the face for you!!  They will straight arm their co-workers and shove them right in front of you to say "hello" first.. They will give their first born to the Romans to sell you a friggen candle.
Commissions must be big $$ here.

We went to the 2nd floor, bed sets.  They had so many bed sets!  (The entire 2nd floor)  And, they had what we were looking for too!  The Hookers.  Mathis Bros stocks very nice high end furniture.

Our experience was this:  We found what we were looking for.  They had it!  On the floor!  And it was beautiful!  The salesman stated they make NO DEALS cuz they guarantee they have the LOWEST prices. Ok.  He checked the price of the bed and said it was discontinued.  But, he'll call the factory and see if they still have it available and call me back tomorrow since it was Sunday.  He did.  He quoted me the price.  Again, said they have the best deals.

So, being a consumer, I went to another furniture store to shop around. They didn't have it on show, but could order it.
She quoted the price $250 higher.

We went back to Mathis and said "we'll take it" to another predator who defeated the weaker animals of the jungle.  He comes back with the same higher price as the other store.  I sayz.. "No... the other cutthroat quoted it was $250 less.  So we argued until we found the original swindler.  Geez, the original guy said he never said that.  I'm getting that feeling of why I dumped my last girlfriend!  "Its the same price anyways, I could buy it from them."  "And you guys state your the lowest prices?"  "Are you crazy?"  "You quoted me less, that's why I'm back!"  "Now your telling me different?" Whatever man!  Whatever.  I'm here, lets get it.

Beware that back end drill.......  Delivery charges are extreme!!!!  considering the expensive furniture, and the markup already.
That wasn't explained earlier so it was a hit on me.  I was flushed on feeling them bend me over.  (My fault of course, I know I coulda walked)  Somebody made out HUGE on that one!!  Shhiieez...    Then they tried to finagle me about joining their "rewards."  It was an extra charge for joining a "rewards program!!"  Whatever dude.  Yes. They will push that.   They push on the savings for joining their "rewards program".  Get this, It cost $$ to join a rewards program. Ha.  Ya, rewards... for THEM.   2% off on pick up items and a few dollars off on the delivery charge.  They said its a great move to sign up!!  I will save!!
Well, I bust out the calculator right in front of  4 sharks pushing it on me and they all walk away.  Classy.  Get this, it cost more to sign up for rewards than it was for the discount they were too give.  But it still didn't stop some of them.   They pushed and pushed for the sale until I just finally lost it and said to F off!

In the end, I got the furniture I was looking for, had fun cussing in their store, my wife was sick and tired waiting for this mockery to end while holding and infant, walked out flushed thinking I probably paid too much.  But its hell of fine furniture.< /Text><Rate>3< /Rate>< response>

< text>
Update: I am pleased to report that the assistant manager came through and rectified the situation. He did a fantastic job and I am satisfied with the resolution.

The items themselves are fantastic. Competitively priced and good quality.
------
I purchased a mattress, box spring, and bed for $1069.29 today  from the Mathis Brothers location in Ontario, CA. It has been a complete fiasco and has resulted in my fiance and me sleeping on the floor tonight.

I arrived at the location around noon and picked a few items out to choose between. The associate on the floor, Albert, told me that if I wanted the items delivered tonight I would have to make a decision within thirty minutes. We made a hasty decision with Ray Santos, the sales associate responsible for my purchase, and proceeded to check out, at which time we were assured that the items would be delivered between 4 and 9 PM.

Two hours later I received a call informing me that my delivery would not be possible tonight. The associate I spoke with told me I could come to the store and pick the items up myself. I asked to speak to Ray, the sales associate, and he repeated the problem, and when I asked what could be done to solve the situation, he asked to call me back.

I waited two hours for Ray to call back and never heard from him. I called the store back at 5:55 and asked for Ray, who had gone home by this time. I was passed on to the assistant manager of sales, who informed me that he would be taking charge of the issue. I offered to come and pick up the items myself but I was told that at this point, the warehouse was closed and that it was impossible to take any items out of the store. As such, my fiance and I are now sleeping on the floor.

At this point I have a delivery tentatively scheduled for tomorrow from 4-9pm and am awaiting a phone call from the assistant manager with an update. He has been working very hard to resolve this issue and has been very helpful. I'm hoping he can find a way to remedy the situation and  I will update my review tomorrow with further information.<//text>

I paid for it over the phone and arranged for delivery to my vacation home which is about 180 miles away.
