<review>This review is a reflection of their management. I was not going to write a review till I was contacted by their region manger and ensured that a local manger will contact me to take care of refunds. After a week later none has called me back.

purchase 2 bedroom sets, living room, dining room set, 3 patio sets, and other items. Once these Items arrived I was informed every item was in stock in the store. Their sales manager Scott, has confirmed every item that Lindsey has picked out for is ready to be picked up. I paid for it over the phone and arranged for delivery to my vacation home which is about 180 miles away. FYI Mathis brother does not "offer complementary delivery even you purchase 100k of furniture".
A love seat and a wine cart was not on the delivery. I was informed that their manager Scott made a mistake. This wouldn't have been a big issue if this was a local delivery. It cost me 2000 to have furniture delivered to my vacation home. My wife contacted them asked them to issue is a refund for the cart and place order for the love seat. They never offerd to help with delivery of the love seat and have not issued a refund for the wine cart. We were told that only manager can do that and he will call us to take care of it. <rating>2< /rating>< Review>
Update: I am pleased to report that the assistant manager came through and rectified the situation. He did a fantastic job and I am satisfied with the resolution.

The items themselves are fantastic. Competitively priced and good quality.
------
I purchased a mattress, box spring, and bed for $1069.29 today  from the Mathis Brothers location in Ontario, CA. It has been a complete fiasco and has resulted in my fiance and me sleeping on the floor tonight.

I arrived at the location around noon and picked a few items out to choose between. The associate on the floor, Albert, told me that if I wanted the items delivered tonight I would have to make a decision within thirty minutes. We made a hasty decision with Ray Santos, the sales associate responsible for my purchase, and proceeded to check out, at which time we were assured that the items would be delivered between 4 and 9 PM.

Two hours later I received a call informing me that my delivery would not be possible tonight. The associate I spoke with told me I could come to the store and pick the items up myself. I asked to speak to Ray, the sales associate, and he repeated the problem, and when I asked what could be done to solve the situation, he asked to call me back.

I waited two hours for Ray to call back and never heard from him. I called the store back at 5:55 and asked for Ray, who had gone home by this time. I was passed on to the assistant manager of sales, who informed me that he would be taking charge of the issue. I offered to come and pick up the items myself but I was told that at this point, the warehouse was closed and that it was impossible to take any items out of the store. As such, my fiance and I are now sleeping on the floor.

At this point I have a delivery tentatively scheduled for tomorrow from 4-9pm and am awaiting a phone call from the assistant manager with an update. He has been working very hard to resolve this issue and has been very helpful. I'm hoping he can find a way to remedy the situation and  I will update my review tomorrow with further information.<//Review>

< text>
Well, I didn't think I would ever have to do this, but here goes.
Let me start by saying that we have purchased multiple rooms of furniture from Mathis Bro.'s in the past, with no complaints.  This time however we're concerned.  We special ordered a lazy boy, power rocker recliner.
Splurging on the  price, since I have a heart condition that requires that I mostly sit to sleep.  (Haven't given in to the idea of a hospital bed yet)
So ,fast forward the many weeks of waiting are over, the chair is delivered.  The delivery guys were great!
It's the right size and upholstery, but not power anything.  So a discussion was had with  customer service,  the chair sent back,  and they would make contact with me ,by days end today....Radio silence. ..
So I  called there after 5pm, was told that an email was sent to someone, to try to figure out where it went wrong.. but no answer was received.  She did assure me however, that if it was their fault,  or lazy boys fault , they would "try to expidite" so that the 8 to 12 week wait could possibly be shorter .  Ok, so who else's fault could it be. I  do know that it is not OURS !  We paid in full for a very expensive special order chair . Which now I have to wait again for?
Look, I get that s**t happens . But here's where YOU fix it  or refund  the money and let us be on our way.  There are many other places that I am sure would appreciate our business.

< text>
Mathis brothers always has a good selection of furniture and I have spent close to 5K shopping here. Everytime the experience has been seamless except for a recent experience. The salesperson that was helping out was very sweet. Since it was close to the holidays, we asked her if she can waive off the delivery charge and she said that she needed to talk to her manager. She was gone for a while and then came back with this guy who was supposedly her "manager". I was expecting the usual sales talk but he surprised me with his insulting attitude. He talked to me as if I am a moron - he said that if the delivery fee was waived, the truck driver would not get any money. I shot back saying that I am asking if they can waive off the charge for me and did not ask that the driver not be paid. He was so condescending that my wife and I left immediately, and honest to God we would have purchased the furniture that day if it were not for this guy.

It may be a longstanding policy that the delivery charge will not be waived, but there is a way to communicate the same to a customer. Such imbeciles should be fired from the premise and not allowed on the salesfloor, let alone walk around with the "manager" title. One less star for the bad "manager" experience.</text>

<user>106106910000415253154<//user><rate>1< /rate><user_name>George Martinez<//user_name><resp>{'time': 1515617712181, 'text': 'George- we are sorry to hear that you are having issues with your new special order recliners. *** READ THE FINAL OUTCOME OF OUR SITUATION BELOW ***
REVISION ‚Äì DON‚ÄôT BUY HERE TILL YOU‚ÄôVE READ THIS!

I wrote a positive 5 star review a few weeks ago about this establishment however our situation has changed drastically. We purchased 2 La-Z-Boy recliners (over $1000) and we picked them up and brought them home. We discovered that the return mechanisms make a horrendous noise when closing the foot support and it doesn't extend high enough to be in a relaxed position (plus a few other problems). We're told that because they ordered them from La-Z-Boy it's considered a "Special Order" and that we're stuck with them poor quality and all. They state it's our fault for not noticing the problems at the showroom and they REFUSE to exchange them. We did not alter anything about the chairs to be considered  a special order they simply don't store them in their warehouse. But this is the way the safeguard themselves from having to deal with their suppliers. So SCREW the customers and make their fortune on 1 time deals. I'm sure we're not the ONLY ONES whom been had by these shysters. We have been long time loyal customers long before "Rit" became their spokesman and I certainly don't intend to be robbed out of my hard earned money and be silent about it. La-Z-Boy is not a cheap brand and why 2 big giants in the industry can't find a way to make things right for their customers is beyond me. The so called customer service rep only repeats what's on her script about them being special order items and never offered to speak with her superior. They sent a contractor out who admitted that this is a major complaint about the brand but it's considered a "Safety issue‚Äù. Good grief, aren‚Äôt there any quality control protocols at any of these establishments or concern enough about their brand??? I will be communicating with La-Z-Boy directly and I will keep everyone posted. Let me know if you've been had by this so called policy at Mathis Bros. I'm curious on how many of us are out there. I did ask to speak with Rit about this situation because I find it hard to believe he would be in agreement with this attitude/policy. I didn't have any intentions of going public with this but the customer rep told me boldly "that will not happen; he doesn't get involved with such matters".   Of course I'll be sharing this on all the other social platforms. We don't want anyone else to get burned at Mathis Brothers.

FINAL REVISION 11/14/18
It's been a few months since my last review of this establishment so here goes. Mathis Bros. did make a final offer after many attempts to settle this dispute. They generously offered to "replace" the defective chairs but only after us agreeing to paying a 30% "restocking charge which was absurd on their part. Their "Customer Retention Mgr" got quite huffy and gave us her ultimate offer. They would accept the defective chairs with no restocking fees but we had to agree on NEVER RETURNING to their store again, true story.  We happily accepted the offer and took the bloody chairs back and received our check in the mail a couple of weeks later. Of course we found other recliners that were less expensive and perform beautifully.  Check it out if you dare to compare; Furniture Planet in Cerritos.< /Review>

<rating>4<//rating>< Text>
Loved the store and the collections. Found great deals in the clearance center. The only thing I don't like about this store is their sales model. One of the sales person told us they are commission only staff. So the minute you walk in the store, Salespeople will greet you and try to help you hoping to make a deal. But it becomes annoying when they follow you everywhere you go. I did ask some questions while we were browsing and told the salesperson that we are just looking and she doesn't need to follow us. She gave us her business card and asked us to call her if we have questions. At the end of our tour, we went to the clearance center and found something we are interested in but not sure if it worked. A sales person standing next to me offered help and brought in power cord to test everything for us.  It turned out everything's working. We decided to buy it. While he was entering our information, the other sales person came over and questioned us why we didn't call her and got upset.  Come on, why am I obligated to call you and wait for you to come over from a remote corner(you will know what I'm talking about if you've been there. The place is almost double the size of a COSTCO warehouse) to give me a simple answer. Based on the answer, I might not make any purchase. And then what? When we were walking out, we saw her again, she gave us a dirty look. How unprofessional.</Text>

<time>1434661492736<//time><user_id>114848862710809973952< /user_id>< text>
WOW! WORTH READING THIS REVIEW...Just tried to order a product online...get to the cart to finalize and it doesn't complete. So I do a chat and I'm told that they are having issues with their system. They ask what item. I tell them and they tell me they have to special order it and it will cost over $150.00 more!!! - what? ...last week when I first inquired about this item via a chat I was told they did have it in stock in my state, confirmed price, and they could have it delivered 24-48 hours and could order it from him ...But today when we are ready to purchase I'm told via a chat with a sales rep that they only carry this item in Oklahoma (no where on the website/cart does it indicate that?) and that is why it would 1. cost more for special order ($150) 2. I could pay $60 to have it transferred from Oklahoma. So I call my local store and get an online sales manager. The online manger kept pretending her cell phone was cutting out when I said, how can you legally do this? What store uses cell phones is one mystery question in itself! I told her that this store should be reported for pricing fraud and it was just silence from her end  - but when I said something about cost if I wanted to buy she could hear me just fine. She said, the terms of agreement says that prices can change - well ya does that mean they can do that after your placed on order - well yes, she said they would have reviewed the order and had to add additional charges - so guess what from my experience their online order pricing is bogus! I read the bad review on this store and thought it was just difficult customers perhaps... all I know is I did my homework on the item - confirmed in a prior chat - placed the order within a week - get to the check out it looks spot on - then the purchase won't go through - You know - I'm really doubting the issue with their online order system today as being a  tech problem is even true - I'm thinking they do not disclose the truth about pricing and when you place the order the system won't let it go through you contact them via chat/phone to see if you are going to be charged (did the order place)... and then the sales rep gives you their number to call them - I'm thinking they are trying to get you really interested in the item and then pull this up pricing on customers. I'm going to contact BBB and Weights and Means about this! Too many other places to purchase furniture - don't waist your time like I have this week!</text>

<Rate>5</Rate><review>I was looking for outdoor furniture in October in California, a no brainer you would think, however it is a most difficult task.  I saw Rit Mathis' advertisement on TV about the best selection of outdoor furniture so I went to the web site.  I ordered and there was an issue,  the table I chose wasn't available, so I ended up driving from the South Bay to Ontario to go to the store and make another choice. < Name>
michael marceaux</Name>
<date>1438730006150</date>< rate>
3<//rate>
< review>
I have mixed feelings about writing this review.  We purchased 3 dresses, 2 night stands, a mattress set, a recliner and a whole office desk set within a month on 5 different trips.  On one hand, lucky, got a great sales person, Laura from the very beginning.  Friendly and patient.  She helped put ideas together, worked on special orders, calls me to reconfirm the deliveries, endlessly try to contact customer service dept on my behalf...etc, a true professional.  On the other hand, the customer service is so bad I'm not sure if we want to purchase anything else from them ever again.

We purchased a chest, after unpacked, noticed that the whole thing was tile to the side, we tried to adjusted the leg pieces, but still the drawers was uneven due to the base unit is lopsided, so we called our sales person.  She apologized, and said she will contact customer service.  A week goes by, nothing from CS.  So I called our sales person again, she contacted CS again, and they finally called.  They told us to bring in the piece to switch it out.  I told them we do not want to move the piece since it's defect already.  I told them since I have another delivery coming, the delivery guys can just take it back and deliver the new unit at the same time.  Well, that was not done on the second delivery since it was not on the paper with the orders, the delivery guys would not take the unit.  Guess who I called again?  Laura contacted CS again, and told me that they now want to send a tech guy out to look at the unit first to determinate if it's fixable.  Another week goes by, no tech calls.  Here we go again...Laura had to send in another request and someone finally called to make an appt for the tech to come out.  We agreed on a visit between 9-10am this morning.  The tech called around 9:55am and said he will be late for 20 mins.  I had a conference call scheduled at 10:30am, so I told him it was okay.  10:30am, still no show, had to rescheduled my conference call since I had no idea when he was going to show up.  Finally at my door at 11:00am.  Take a look at the chest, turn the little screw at the bottom of the leg and tells me it's fixed.  I'm not sure if he think I was the housewives of IE or if I looked stupid or what?  NO! The chest is not fixed since it's still lopsided, so I insisted on switching out for another one.  We now had this piece of chest for almost a month...Then he asked me why I was so angry, duh!!!  You were so late to start with, wasted my valuable time, and treat me liked a 6 year old!  If my employee did that to my clients, I would have fired them.  Now the tech tells me he has to take pictures of the unit, and someone will contact me within 48 hours to let me know what the decision is.  Really???  I called the sales manager Scott as soon as he left, and thank you Scott, he had it taken care of within 2 hours.  Will redeliver another unit and pick up the defect one in 3 days.  Now, that wasn't so hard, was it?  Why they made me wait for a whole month and the run around is beyond me, especially after we spent more then 7K at the store?

With our mattress delivery, we also purchased pillows and bed protector.  The delivery guys left out the protector, so again, called Laura.  At least this one was an easy fix, they FedEx it within 3 days.
So the bottom lines is, nothing is prefect.  Which is fine and understandable when some furniture turns out to have defects, or sometimes human error happens.  But I'm not sure what I would of done without my salesperson dealing with the CS dept on my behalf tirelessly.

Kudos to Laura for being a true sport, and to Mr. Mathis, you should really look into your CS dept and the cashier dept.  Twice I was there late, trying to pay the order before the store closes.  Only one cashier at the counter both times, with 3-4 different people behind the counter doing not sure what?  And a line of customers for that last minute purchase.  Hey, it's retail, all hands should be on deck right before closing, why not finish it with great customer service especially for the paying clients???<//review>

<user>113286428228034761875</user><name>Tim Lu<//name><date>1491016159511< /date><rating>1<//rating>< text>
On 2/17/2017, I went there and wanted to get a sofa set that can be deliver right away (i.e. in stock). I ended up liking a sofa and love seat plus some other thing. The sofa was in stock and ready for deliver next day. However, the love seat was out of stock.

I was still a little worry because the last time another furniture store did not delivery. The sales person repeatedly promised me that it will get to me before March, as I keep asking if she was sure about it. So I went and pay the whole set in full. The first piece got delivered the next day, but the second one is still not here...
I contact the sales person serval times in between. First was, it got delayed to end of March because it's oversea. This was around mid March. As I needed the furniture before April, I thought I'd give them some slack, so I waited.
Fast forward to 3/29, word is it got delayed again to mid April. So I called the sales person to express my anger about the broken promise and that I'd like to return the order and get my money back. She just said sorry there is nothing she can do... Then the manager called me back to say he will figure out a way and give me an answer by the end of March.
Now it's the end of March, no call back from the manager, no call back from the sales person. Nothing.
This place is full of lies. Don't trust any word from these people.

TLDR: sales person repeatedly promised delivery date, 1 month passed and nothing show up. Store manager called saying he will have answer in 2 days, no call back. FULL OF LIES.</text>

<pictures>None< /pictures>< review>
From 1st to Worst!
My girlfriend and I recently bought our sectional couch from Mathis Brothers in Ontario and had a GREAT shopping experience with salesman Ray Santos who helped us with our selection. The rest of our experience has been a total nightmare dealing with Mathis Brothers. The delivery guys damaged the sectional by almost completing tearing off the dust cover under the sectional, when asked if they where going to repair the damage they said they forgot their staple gun and would have their service department contact us.

After 4 days and no response we contacted Mathis Brothers and was transferred back and forth for over 30 minutes before being transferred back to the original customer service person who took the call. I had to tell her not to transfer again. She took my purchase info  and did nothing with it, after another week went by no response from Mathis Brothers we asked a relative to help us fix the sectional, which he did.  So like I said GREAT initial service with sales and WORST experience with customer services and service department. Would recommend caution when purchasing with Mathis Brothers.<//review>

<review>Biggest show room and more visual options than any other furniture store in the vicinity including; Living Spaces, Jerome's and Furniture Restoration Outlet at the Mills.  The prices are unbeatable.  I price matched EVERYWHERE (even online) before I went to MB and I was pleasantly surprised at how bottom line the prices are.  They do not negotiate on price because they don't have to.  I realized as soon as I made my first walk through that I would be purchasing from MB because of the available options, Quality and PRICE.  Delivery fee VERY reasonable and the customer service is unbeatable.  Follow up phone calls for delivery schedule confirmation, call when delivery in route and follow up call to confirm delivery.  Our leather sofas are PIMP!  And we are very picky when it comes to quality.  A weeee bit of a negative is that our sales associate was breathing down our neck for a bit so I asked him politely to give my wife and I some privacy, and he did.  EXCELLENT, EXCELLENT, EXCELLENT!  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!  And NO I do not work for MB nor was I paid for this review.  LOL.  My sofa had a little knick in it, probably happened during delivery.  I called customer service and they delivered a replacement the next day!  Like, am I sleeping?  Seriosuly.  They earn their business.</review>< user>

< text>
I ordered a custom couch September 2016. At the time of the order I was impressed how helpful the salesman, Kevin Worley was. When my couch finally arrived in November the order was completely wrong. I refused delivery and of course called my salesman.  He said he would check on it the next day however I never received a callback. When I called him again the following day to inquire as to the status of my couch, his response was "why are you calling me, it is my day off.  Call service."  Ok then why in the hell did he give me his business card?  I called service and explained my situation. I felt like service was treating me like what I had received was the couch I ordered when it was obviously wrong; wrong style and wrong color of pillows. After being left on hold for 15 minutes, the service Manager Sung Ching said he would look into it and will definitely call me by noon the following day. After again not receiving a callback the following day and again asking service about the couch, the next response received was that the service manager was busy and would check the couch in the warehouse later.  Not until the third day did the service manager call me back and apologized about the error. Not until that time did I feel I was receiving any kind of positive customer service. The couch was re-ordered and it is beautiful.  I received it yesterday.  I was very disappointed in the customer service until they realized it was entirely MB error. As far as Mr Worley, wow I was astonished as to his lack of willingness to help. I guess he received his commission and was done with me. Will I shop Mathis Brothers again?  I honestly don't know.</text>

</record>
</dataset><record>
<user_id>111477790785342808302</user_id><Name>Bob Fass</Name>< date>
1407640401833</date>
<rating>2< /rating>< Text>
I had hoped a showroom of this size would be a real winner for our furniture purchases. We recently bought a new house and have many items we need. Our first impression was positive. There is a large selection and a variety of prices. Yes, it appeared that there is also a large variety of quality, but that is to be expected. Also to be expected is that your shopping experience will not be private. A salesperson will attach themselves to you almost immediately and follow you around the store to answer any questions you may have. They are polite and knowledgeable, but it still feels a little intrusive.

Our first purchase was a media center for our family room. One item in the set had to be special ordered, so I was warned it might take up to 12 weeks to receive our delivery. However, it was ready in four weeks and delivered conveniently to my home. Unfortunately, one item in the set was damaged and had to be replaced. Customer service apologized and said they would replace the item as quickly as possible and ordered a new one to be delivered a week later.

I was hoping for a quicker response, but I was at least satisfied that it would be handled professionally. So I went back for a second purchase. This time I did NOT have a good salesperson. He talked me into ordering furniture that was not available to see on the showroom floor. When I went to pick it up it was in boxes and needed to be assembled. I was not told this originally, but I accepted the order anyway. When I got home, unpacked everything and assembled it, I was not satisfied with what I saw. I called immediately and asked how I could return the merchandise.

I was told I could return it assembled and that I would be charged a 10% restocking fee. Shouldn't I be charging them 10% for assembly? I informed the customer service representative that I found a restocking fee unacceptable given that I was not able to preview the item on the showroom floor. I was told coldly that this was a corporate policy and nothing could be done. I was offered the opportunity to have them keep my money and give me store credit toward my next unfulfilling purchase.

I responded that warehouse stores like Costco and higher-end retail stores like Nordstrom  and Pottery Barn have exceptional customer service policies, which is why customers keep coming back. I asked which store Mathis Brothers aspired to become.

In the end, they can keep my 10% restocking fee with my thanks. I've learned a very valuable lesson early in my customer relationship. I'm thankful they only got 10% of a smaller purchase, before I spent my savings with them on furnishing the rest of my house.

I won't be back, and I cannot recommend this store to anyone else. Go where they appreciate your return patronage and want to build a long-term customer relationship rather than make a quick buck at your expense.<//Text>

<date>1361138837222< /date><Rating>2< /Rating><review>This has been a nightmare working with the Ontario Mathis Brothers customer service department. We purchased a sofa and loveseat at Mathis Brothers about two years ago and also bought the extended warranty in the event either piece would break. The recliner loveseat broke in about two years. We were given a store credit since the existing furniture was not repairable, so we upgraded and paid extra for a better quality sofa and loveseat. Throughout our dealings by phone and in person to select a new set of furniture, we were NEVER told, either orally from our numerous phone calls or in writing as we were arranging the purchase, that the old furniture (which we paid for in full and was ours) needed to be returned in order to get the store credit, which we purchased the warranty to cover. No written requirement for the old furniture was communicated, and even when I spoke with their delivery representative the day before delivery, I was told "we don't take the old furniture" so we had a family who needed them pick them up before the delivery. Mathis Brothers would not leave our new furniture without taking the old furniture, which we already paid for and was ours to give away, and had already paid for the $200 extended coverage. We spoke with customer service rep, Jazime and Michelle and received the worst experience we have ever had in trying to help us resolve the issue. Along with using words like "stupid" because our understanding of store credit wasn't hers ("you only get a store credit if you bring back what was broken") which is contrary to most others definition of a store credit. After thinking we couldn't have any worse experience with Mathis Brothers, we then spoke with a Supervisor named Jonathan Arnold who had to be the worst representative Mathis Brothers could have hired. Along with implying we were "liars", he was not even willing to discuss options to salvage our experience. We currently have a pending purchase for additional furniture that we will no longer be pursuing because of the terrible and condescending service we just experienced this morning. Speaking with Operations Manager Laura Canon, who said we would be considered "thieves" by not giving them the old broken furniture and saying and I quote: "Their is no customer service dealing with you people". I can only warn others that aside from a simple transaction where no executive decisions have to me made, buyer beware!! Mathis Brothers has lost two faithful customers who would have been loyal customers for future purchases. This is by far the WORST experience I have ever had! < review>
This has been a nightmare working with the Ontario Mathis Brothers customer service department. We purchased a sofa and loveseat at Mathis Brothers about two years ago and also bought the extended warranty in the event either piece would break. The recliner loveseat broke in about two years. We were given a store credit since the existing furniture was not repairable, so we upgraded and paid extra for a better quality sofa and loveseat. Throughout our dealings by phone and in person to select a new set of furniture, we were NEVER told, either orally from our numerous phone calls or in writing as we were arranging the purchase, that the old furniture (which we paid for in full and was ours) needed to be returned in order to get the store credit, which we purchased the warranty to cover. No written requirement for the old furniture was communicated, and even when I spoke with their delivery representative the day before delivery, I was told "we don't take the old furniture" so we had a family who needed them pick them up before the delivery. Mathis Brothers would not leave our new furniture without taking the old furniture, which we already paid for and was ours to give away, and had already paid for the $200 extended coverage. We spoke with customer service rep, Jazime and Michelle and received the worst experience we have ever had in trying to help us resolve the issue. Along with using words like "stupid" because our understanding of store credit wasn't hers ("you only get a store credit if you bring back what was broken") which is contrary to most others definition of a store credit. After thinking we couldn't have any worse experience with Mathis Brothers, we then spoke with a Supervisor named Jonathan Arnold who had to be the worst representative Mathis Brothers could have hired. Along with implying we were "liars", he was not even willing to discuss options to salvage our experience. We currently have a pending purchase for additional furniture that we will no longer be pursuing because of the terrible and condescending service we just experienced this morning. Speaking with Operations Manager Laura Canon, who said we would be considered "thieves" by not giving them the old broken furniture and saying and I quote: "Their is no customer service dealing with you people". I can only warn others that aside from a simple transaction where no executive decisions have to me made, buyer beware!! Mathis Brothers has lost two faithful customers who would have been loyal customers for future purchases. This is by far the WORST experience I have ever had! If I could've scored them "Less than Poor" I would have!!!< /review>
